intro: Lapeirousia zambeziaca, commonly known as the Zambezi orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
